intro: Krokia adenoclada, commonly known as the desert lily, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its tall, erect stem and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant has adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments through its deep root system and water-storing tissues. Its leaves are typically narrow and reduced, minimizing water loss through transpiration. Krokia adenoclada plays an important ecological role in its habitat by providing nectar for pollinators and supporting local biodiversity.
